review.description: i feel a little stingy giving them 2 stars - maybe read an additional 1/2 star? - but i am loathe to go any higher.  the burger (classic) was decent but nothing i'll remember or crave upon leaving.  i've definitely had better (e.g. two8two, shake shack, the commodore).  if you're gonna try to break into the burger scene here, i think maybe try offering something more distinctively yummy?  if not, why bother?  or at least why bother opening in some place that isn't times square?  yes, that suggested location is intentional because the decor/fixin's screams brash and um, tacky.  sorry, but really, what's with the 80s "contemporary" light fixtures and big ass lettering littering the walls?  gosh, i'm feeling a little bad about the direction this review is taking, but obviously not enough to stop.  i think it must be the complete bafflement over why this place is even considered a contender.  it certainly can't be because of their sweet potato fries, which are okay but maybe too greasy and too herby.  it's almost like thanksgiving dinner, eating them, when all you want is a good burger side.  come here if you're in the area, i guess, but don't make any special trips.  if you wanna plan a satisfying burger outing in downtown brooklyn, go to two8two instead.  seriously.
review.author: Tina E.
